Lamb chops are so good! Especially with the sauce! The servers was very attentive! Different people always engaged in conversation I was only able to remember Mario’s name. And the bartender Luis was really good at the passion fruit margaritas! You can tell the fish was fresh! Came straight out the oven! And everything was seasoned perfectly, never have to ask for salt or anything!

We had the best time and the lamb was to die for. The ceviche was divine and the calamari fresh and fabulous. Its a great place for a good time with less then 3 people would be good. Keep in mind covid is still a thing and this restaurant is a bit small so plan accordingly.

Love this place, despite the fact I can't order much from the menu. It is mostly seafood(which I don't eat), but I still love it. The service was excellent, the waiter checked in on us often and was friendly. Drinks are so good and  they have happy hour. I ordered a delicious passionfruit mojito and all of the sangrias are also yummy. I did have the meatballs which were good, but a bit over priced for only 4 meatballs. The Bronx has some wonderful food, but not so much of it around the Yankee Stadium area and the courthouses. But then Porto salvo opened up and everything changed. This place simply has delicious home-cooked food. The menu is fun - short rib pasta, delicious seafood, making it more than a mirage in a food desert, but rather an absolutely necessary addition and hopefully the start of a culinary scene around the area.

My first time at this Italian Restaurant and everything went great! The place from the outside looks inviting and calls your attention. Its a bit small inside with a Nautical theme, dim lights, and a intimate setting but this is great for dates or just a couple of drinks afterwork during their happy hours. As soon as you walk in you'll notice the bar on the left surrounded by Tables and seats. The place wasn't that packed at the time I went, so things where comfortable. Its clean, organize, and nicely decorated. Our waitress was so nice and had plenty of patience with us as we had a bit of a difficult time understand some parts of the Meñu. Dishes have Italian titles on the Meñu, I found that some dishes are difficult to pronounce but theres also a brief description under each dish title. Other than that which is really no big deal, the food wait time was fair and the food and drinks itself where delicious. I couldn't ask for better service. Be advised this Restaurant does not have customer parking, they do accept credit cards and debit cards for payments, and the prices for food and drinks are fair. Great experience here, I would definitely comeback. 👍 Thank you and Enjoy.

Love going here! Always delicious and memorable. A very cozy estambishment with great friendly vibes. Have to try everything off the menu, great wines. Looking forward to going back. A true Bronx Gem 😀

I work in the area and am thankful that there is an alternative to fast food-something that I don't eat! You will wait for your food but it is worth it! Fresh,  flavorful and beautiful presentation.  The cocktail and wine list is good and pairs well with the menu. The pricing is good, too. The only negative was my grilled octopus appetizer- it was tough, dry and overcooked-similar to a tongue of a shoe! A pity as the accompaniment salad was good.

Really good food. Cozy space,  good prices. Good drinks. I tried their mojito de coco and passionfruit and it was really good the same with their sangria. Is a nice place to go and get out of the routine.  They have out  seating in the summer. Is not a big place but the food is great. I would really recommend it. I have been there multiple times. They have varieties of desserts and drinks too. If you just want to go to drink or eat this is the place for you.

This is my first review of Porto Salvo in about 2 years, and I'm really happy to award 5 stars and they fully deserve.  The trick is not so much to be on top when you start out, but to maintain if not exceed that high level after being in business for a couple of years; staying the course takes a long term commitment and complete dedication.  The quality of food and its preparation at Porto Salvo is outstanding, and the value for your dining out dollar here is just excellent.  Compare Porto Salvo to any Italian restaurant in New York City that purports to offer fresh seafood and southern Italian dishes, and you'll find that PS exceeds them all when it comes to quality, price and ambience.  They do not scrimp on quality here and there is no such thing as slapdash preparation or presentation.  An added bonus is that both the bar and wait staff are lovely and professional; both have improved markedly since the opening, and play a critical role in the success of this establishment.

Food is delicious & diverse yet expensive. The restaurant is sleek & the bathrooms are clean. They specialize in seafood appetizers& entree’s. The seafood is perfectly cooked & fresh. I order the grilled octopus & house wine all the time. Great for meet ups & small groups.

This is a very nice and cozy place to dine when in the Bronx. A few dishes we had were very tasty and well prepared.  For a appetizer we shared the Sauteed calamari. Olives,garlic, capers in a light tomato sauce. For dinner, it was the Cavatelli Salsiccia with homemade Cavatelli. Delicious. My guest had the Branzino al Vino Bianco. Another tasty dish well prepared.

Not to be taken lightly, as he grew up on Long island! Staff was on point as well as the cocktails! Return visits assured. Thank you for a wonderful dinner.

Was extremely impressed with the restaurant!!! Service was great, establishment clean and pleasant with good music, but most importantly, the food is amazing. Fresh bread to dip into Evoo and ricotta, the pesto pasta was out of this world, and the skirt steak was made to perfection. The salad are fresh and tasted great, good balance  of sweet and filling. Also price isn’t too bad, very fair. Overall, if you’re in the area and hungry, come here and you won’t regret one but.

Really cute place in an area you wouldn't expect. The food was delicious and reasonably priced. Happy hour was good though wish there were more beer options. Staff are helpful and friendly. I had the bucatini amatriciana which was delicious but I was really envious of my friend whose meal looked and tasted even better. She had the skirt steak with potatoes.  I'll definitely be back... tomorrow!

I had an amazing experience at Porto Salvo. This little gem in the heart of the Bronx is just amazing for me to find and have a great meal app. To top it off this place has outdoor seating which is absolutely Epic, the food was amazing I had the macaroni and cheese with crab meat and for drinks you must I repeat you must have the rosé sangria!!!! I was there with a group and we play tennis every weekend, they were very accommodating and actually split our checks for each and every person! We were also visited by both owners one of which is also the chef this is very old school in really happens! So if you're looking for a progressive Italian food in a all inclusive atmosphere! This is a must to go to! I wish I lived closer to this place I would pop in for a drink and order food or appetizers at their bar......happy pride
Food and drinks were great. Nice, cute, little and intimate spot for family and friends get togethers.

We walked 20 minutes up E 161 St. from Yankee Stadium before the game to have dinner at Porto Salvo. The experience was genuinely very good and relaxing, especially getting off the busy street. This cuisine is all about seafood, and trepidation about eating raw shellfish in a new venue quickly disappeared when we were served cold blue point oysters and tuna tartare, both very good. My partner ordered cavatelli with sausage and I had the fisherman's stew with cod, shrimp, mussels, calamari and tiny clams in a tomato broth. The wine list was good, approachable, and affordable. Porto Salvo is a seriously good find in the dearth of restaurants near Yankee Stadium and I recommend it without reservation. /Peter F.

Fantastic meal - lovely atmosphere. The charcuterie for two is enough for four. Enjoyed the lamb ragu as an entree - rich, meaty and perfectly seasoned. Excellent service. House wines are wonderful and a great bargain

TL;DR: The food was very well worth every penny, the bartender was excellent as well. The service is what is lacking here.  First night in New York we decided to get some food as we had just got off a three hour flight. We lifted to Porto Salvo as the reviews and food sounded amazing, and believe me we were not wrong. The food was delicious abd drinks were a treat, the only downside was the wait. I'm not sure but maybe they were understaffed but it took close to an hour from ordering our drinks to bring out the food and the butternut squash ravioli came out lukewarm at best. We asked for it to be heated back up which took another 20 minutes.  I would definitely recommend this to a friend or go back again as the food was the star of the place - as it should be.

Friend recommended this place. A lovely addition to the Bronx. Ate here with 3 friends. We all ordered a variety of drinks which were well prepared. Had 2 appetizers - one with figs which was truly outstanding (Fichi Ripiene) and one of the bruschetta choices. Each one of us had a different entree and we all ate every drop. The owners seem to be there a lot; had a nice chat with them. Definitely try this restaurant if you are in the area.

His accent is as thick as the freshly made pasta and the meal did not disappoint a long time Native NewYorker who bypassed little  Italy and Arthur ave to savor this Absolute gem of a restaurant where every bite from any menu greets your palate with fresh and delightful flavors !! Worth the trip for tastes you won't forget and will plan to return within the month with more pals to share plates at this culinary delight !!!!

I mean come on look at this presentation, it tasted exactly the way it looked. Huge fan of this space and my organization constantly orders and holds events here all the time. Definitely one of the good ones in the Boogie Down. The ambience is the first thing you notice (classy af), definitely a place you can bring a date to but also go grab a few drinks with friends at.  The pricing is perfect, 3 friends, multiple drinks, 2 apps and 3 entrees for 106.00- you can’t beat that. Arturo, our server was friendly, informative and knew his menu. Great suggestions and always attentive. Will come back again and again and support this business.  Keep up the great work Porto Salvo, you are a fine establishment and hope others get a chance to experience what I did tonight.

I went there for a birthday party. The place is too small for the magnitude of the party size that I participated in. However, it is a very nice intimate restaurant. Nice place to go if you want to hang out with friends or family. The food is traditional italian style and it was very good. The ambiance is also very nice with dim lighting, candles and artwork which decorates the walls. The service was excellent. I highly recommend this cute and quaint local spot which compliments the area very nicely.

Where should I begin...ok let’s start from the beginning. My sister told me she saw this place on her way home(bus) so she google it and told me it had great reviews( I’m super picky with food) so she wanted to try it out and so we went there on a Saturday afternoon and started with appetizer bruschetta with mushroom, cheese and truffle oil that was divine! The we of course order drinks and then the main course! That salmon was soooooo delicious! And my sisters pasta was great! I loved the desserts...Over all I am soo glad that she found that place because it my new favorite place! I will strongly recommend this amazing restaurant because the food  was delicious and the people that work there were just so friendly and I love the whole experience! I went back...took my sisters on a “Sister date night” and they loved it!

Love the intimate setting, the staff and the food. All around good time.

So if your looking for "American" Italian then your in the wrong place. This is real traditional Italian food and is fabulous . I been here three times and each time I've like it more and more . I tried the small plates and the large plates and let me tell you there portions are HUGE. Came here for brunch expecting a small traditional plate and boy was I wrong . The portions were huge and flavorful . The drinks are great and they only carry the local breweries. I will definitely come here again

Great place, great food, great vibe, and great services. Over all a great birthday dinner. The waiter was very helpful when we had any questions. Paid close attention when I told him how I wanted my drink and he executed it very well. The food was delicious. Will recommend to anyone.
LOVE THIS PLACE! The service is great, and the food is awesome!!!! any time I'm in this area I make sure to stop in!
Love this place!

The background music of R&B 70's music added to the ambiance! The waiter was professional and courteous. The food and dessert tasted delicious! I will definitely be going back! This is a great place for a date!
Nice people and great food
Nice place for casual dinning.
Great place! Come see for yourself.
Food is sooo good! Drinks are also great - a bit sweet so definitely drink lots of water. A really great secret spot in the bronx.
Wonderful
Pricing and food very reasonable.  Very friendly staff. Meal came quick.

The lamb fusilli was wonderful.  Very flavorful. Nice wine selection. Helpful staff. I would not recommend it for people with food allergies,  however,  as my co-worker was unable to find anything that was not cross contaminated. But if you don't have food allergies,  the food is amazing and well worth the visit.  Will be going back my next trip.

Omg where can I start it’s amazing it’s like another home to me I used to be there almost everyday one day I was there 4 straight days in a row lol I’m planning on sharing my experience there thru my YouTube channel as soon as I have it running again.  Their food is delicious I’ll talk in details the excellence in the almost all foods I tasted still more to eat there.  I already have some favorites that I can call orgasmic lol also I have some deserts in that category too lol.  They start you off with fresh iced water in a glass pitcher and fresh bread warm slices with a lil olive oil and lite cream cheese mixed to dip your bread in.  Listen some might say it’s pricey but if you go somewhere in the city you will pay double or triple the price and theirs might not be as authentic and genuine Italian food made from scratch organic style fresh clean delicious makes you think you are eating in Italy without going to Italy.  For more details and hopefully pics when I learn how to do it in YouTube I will share it with everyone here.  So far I been served by Arturo a very nice respectful young Spanish speaking bilingual man he is excellent in helping you decide on what you feel to eat and gives you a great description as well of whatever you may be curious about in the menu.  Also I been served by Andrea a beautiful sweet loving caring nice Italian young female who knows her hometown food freshness and can help you the same as Arturo these people are awesome beautiful and great.  I want to thank Mr. Luigi for his awesome great authentic fresh Italian foods and deserts that he has put lots of time energy and strength to making it possible to serve the Neighborhood community in the Bronx at a good price for great food.  I love u all it’s like family time in there for me.  God bless u all.
Good service. Nice food.. very nice drink. But the most I loved was the tiramisu. That was awesome.
Not my cup of tea. Drinks are over price.  $13.00 for a swig of Hennessey. And its always a ghost town.
So chill bro. . The music is chill the boat theme. Is nastalgic. The waitress is nice . The price is right . Come on down.

This South Bronx newcomer dishes out Italian seaside cuisine in a rustic, elegant setting. Bruschetta are a great start, but I go for the oysters. The plates here are varied and equally tasty. A beer selection featuring local brews complements extensive wine list. Great service and ambience.
Great local space with reasonable prices and good services. Enjoy before our gets crowded

A small cute and cozy spot  in the south Bronx for a drink with an appetizer or two. The music will have you swaying and their short ribs of beef over mushrooms and rice risotto with a hint of cheese is priceless. Give it a try and you may just like it.
Great homemade pasta dishes.
The food here is life.  So good and tasty.

The best brunch ever!!! I cant wait to return for dinner in the near future. Its been a while since I've experienced the "Old World" charm and taste. I truly missed it. "Buona fortuna al proprietario e all'intero staff di Porto Salvo. Goditi tutti!!!
Comfortable, cozy and Excellent food!
No exaggeration....This Place is absolutely fantastic....Celebrating Mom’s 84th over a Sunday Brunch. Professional and accommodating staff. Warm atmosphere. I wish them the very best!!!

A nice hidden gem, with wonderful decor in the Bronx. I had an enjoyable Saturday brunch. The service was perfect. I am eager to try dinner!  It would be great to see a bit more organic products on the menu, but hey, this is a good surprise as it stands in the Bronx!
Very nice spot, I like the theme of the restaurant and the food is great. Their custom brewed beer is totally awesome!! Must visit
Amazing!!!
Loved the place! Amazing food for good price and the bartender is really great. Definitely recommend this place.

Chef was really nice and offered to make us a fresh pasta because the pasta we had wasn't al dente, we were fine because the food was still delicious but they were very kind and still comped us a dessert. Great food, great staff, will definitely return!

The New Year Eve Dinner Menu is to die for, every dish was an explosion of flavor and the portion were filling. The drink menu is everything. If you are in the Bronx stop by this quaint little spot with great italian food.
Wonderful service with a friendly atmosphere . Thanks Mark. it was great meeting you 👍 The food was delicious 💯👌
Nice and delicious food.
Great place for having Cocktails
I try to make it every Tuesdays since I work nearby... Love Happy Hour... red sangria,wine, beers and all the small plates.
This new restaurant offers delicious small plates, great service and delicious drinks.  Open for lunch, dinner and brunch.  You will come back often.

It's my first time dining here it's a gem in an awkward area but hey about time SB has something true a real Italian restaurant not just your basic pizza/pasta restaurant or the traditional chicken parm and spaghetti place (nothing wrong with those places) but something a little different with nice ambiance and fun arrangements..I'm definitely spreading the word
They do a great job from start to finish.  We need more.
The food was delicious!! Best in the Bronx!!! A gem in the south Bronx!!

I was in for the ALCS game 3 representing my Astros.  This place is legit!  Chris took care of me at the bar and gave me a great lecture on the Bronx.  I had the crab cake, caprese salad and eggplant parmasan...they were all great.
(Translated by Google) It is a very cozy place  (Original) Es un lugar muy acojedor
Good food and service
Great italian food. Small plates for small prices.

I came to this place on my first trip to NYC with a group of friends for brunch. The quality and presentation of the food was outstanding. Very authentic dishes with fresh ingredients and a varied wine selection. The staff went above and beyond to cater to all our needs and were very courteous and professional. Even the owner came out  to greet us and ensure that we were properly taken care of. Great atmosphere all around, good music, and top quality service. I will definitely visit again when I'm back in NYC.
Excellent place nice atmosphere. Great attention
Food, service, staff, ambiance is A+++ quality!!! So happy to have found a place such as this one in my neighborhood in The Bronx! Bravahhhhhh! 👏
(Translated by Google) There is a lot of atmosphere, good food, good drinks and good wines .....  (Original) Hay mucho ambiente, buena comida, buenas bebidas y buenos vinos.....
Really delicious

Owners, staff, food, cocktails, music, atmosphere, design, taste, price, people just amazing. Once week I have to come here. Best place in the Bronx for real and authentic artistic italian experience.
Attempt to keep things authentic, the menu is a little tough to read as a result. Need a better selection of beer. Haven't tried the wine yet.

The Food was good and a nice ambience. i recommend the Moscow Mule and the pink Sangria which were delicious.  The staff was very nice as well.  My only complaint is that i went for Brunch and wanted  chicken added to my Carbonara and they said they could not do substitutions even when they had other dishes in the menu with chicken; i even offered to pay extra for it but it was not possible.

So great to have a place like this in the neighborhood! The staff is friendly, the drinks are awesome and it's always great to have an engaging conversation with the owner. I'm excited to continue to patronize and watch this place succeed!
Amazining attention to details.
Great atmosphere and very delicious food! I had the special of the night short ribs, and my wife had the branzino filet. They are amazing! We will be coming back for sure!
The service and atmosphere was top notch! I ordered the Chicken Milanese which was fried perfectly but had no flavor at all. The bruschetta with paté was amazing

My husband and I came here after work to enjoy an amazing 80-degree summer day. We ordered drinks and sat outside under the umbrella in front. It was a great experience from beginning to end. I highly recommend and look forward to trying their brunch.

Porto Salvo is melo... just a very laxed place with GREAT service!!! Jennifer is extremely attentive and she KNOWS the menu. Tell her what you have a taste for and she'll take care of the rest.  Drinks are tasty, the look of the place is well complimented by the lighting and last but not least, the food is delicious!!!  I personally recommend the lamb, Cavatelli Salsiccia & Pepperoni, Frittelle Di Cavolflore and Chicken Milanese.  A Local Blessing for your tastebuds!!!
Great Food & Drinks I'll Come To This Place More Often, Def A Much Needed Place In The South Bronx
Food was Delicious as well and the Red Sangria

The south Bronx doesn't have many chilled good places to eat and grab a happy hour drink while you're at it. This is one place I support. Customer service is great, Jennifer the bartender is friendly along with the rest of the staff. Food was great (salmon was so tender I definitely recommend it, sorry don't know the name of the platter😅) and overall I had a good time right before my Yankee game.

What a nice spot in South Bronx! I came to visit my friend near Yankees Stadium and accidentally found this beautiful restaurant with many design details. The food was flavorful and well-presented. I ordered Grilled Octopus as appetizer, and it was with right consistency and not chewy. My main dish was Pescatrice al Vino Bianco (monk fish with white wine sauce.) It was fresh and delicious. I usually don't like bean, but however they prepared Cannellini beans was to be commended because I left nothing on my plate. They had 6 desert choices and I had chosen Basil Crème Brulee since I had never heard of Basil and Crème Brulee together. I was pleasantly surprised. the infusion of the basil provides additional fresh coolest to the warm and not too sweet creaminess, Great finish! I would definitely come back.
Love the ambiance. The service. The food.
Cool spot. Small plates are decent.
the food is really really good
Food is great.   Service is very good as well.  Looking forward to many more meals.  I think the menu should add a few more appetizers including wings.

Porto Salvo is the new debut spot . Its swanky Great hospitality from the staff. The food was awesome  and reasonably priced for any sophisticated palate. All I can say is Bronxit's Come show some love and let us welcome them with open arms. Especially Jennifer Who is very warm and hospitable. Porto Salvo thanks for making my Thursday evening unforgettable.

Legit, legit spot. Random location that you could say is "good for the area", but this would be good anywhere in the City. Food and service are quality. 15 minute walk from the courts, Stadium and The Hub.
Nice place with good energy

What a refreshing change to my neighborhood! The staff was amazing and attentive. The bread and ricotta roasted peppers was truly out the box; both my wife and I were really impressed with Porto Salvo since we both are foodies!  Food was amazingly delicious. Most definitely not the traditional Italian cliche restaurant that serves chicken parmigiana! Food is much more exquisite and upscale.

Finally, class has come to the Bronx. Nothing in the South Bronx (sobro) has nothing that can touch Porto Salvo or even come close to. Finally a classy joint, only a few block away from home, where excellent food is served under an elegant ambiance. With a good selection of local draft beer and variety of reds and white wine to complement fabulous Italian/Spanish tapas. Porto salvo also serve pasta entree as well to complete your appetite.  I am genuinely impressed with the decor, bossa nova music, and friendly staff. I even got to meet Mark (part owner I believe). Extremely welcoming and eager to meet locals and have a friendly chat.  I truly believe that Porto Salvo was desperately needed in the Bronx which is a great play to its name "saved port".  For locals there's no longer a need to enter manhattan for a classy dining experience. And it's well worth it to come into the Bronx to pay a visit, have a few drink with quality fresh food.  Weather you want to enjoy a drink after a game (Yankees or NYCFC) or work, or just simply in the neighborhood. Have a romantic evening with a date, Porto Salvo is definitely a must.
The food was amazing words can't even describe how good! The service from not only the waiter but the owners was outstanding would definitely recommend this lovely place to everyone!
